page.title: 20GOVERNMENT
page.content: An interview with the local M.P. On saturday afternoon I interviewed Mr.Paddy Ashdown and asked him if he thought Westland would have to close due to their present crisis.He thought not as the Government has promised new orders and he hopes the firm will expand and more small businesses will start.He says the town must be careful to preserve old buildings to encourage visitors and investment.There are 11,000 council houses around Yeovil,many of which have been sold, which is good for the country but not for Yeovil. Mr.Ashdown is a Liberal and won the Yeovil seat in the last election after many years of Conservative representation.
